itemDescription: Member of the United Kingdom Parliament for Scottish constituencies

wikipedia_page.main: David Robertson, 1st Baron Marjoribanks (2 April 1797 – 19 June 1873), was a Scottish stockbroker and politician.

response: ** David Robertson, 1st Baron Marjoribanks, Scottish stockbroker, politician (d. 1873)

The previous bridge was a timber trestle built between 1838 and 1839 by J. Blackmore. The bridge was funded by subscribers purchasing shares; David Robertson, 1st Baron Marjoribanks paid L.3000, and ten others paid L.500 each.

The Marjoribanks Baronetcy, of Lees in the County of Berwick, was created in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom on 6 May 1815 for John Marjoribanks, Member of Parliament for Buteshire and BerwickshireEscott, Margaret "Marjoribanks, Sir John, 1st bt. (1763–1833), of Lees, Berwick" a member biography in the History of Parliament: the House of Commons 1820–1832, ed. D.R.
